docstr: `CEILING` — Integer ceiling function ### Description `CEILING(A)` returns the least integer greater than or equal to `A`. ### Syntax `RESULT = CEILING(A [, KIND])` ### Arguments . | `KIND` | (Optional) An `INTEGER` initialization expression indicating the kind parameter of the result. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER(KIND)` if `KIND` is present and a default-kind `INTEGER` otherwise. ### Example ``` program test_ceiling     real :: x = 63.29     real :: y = -63.59     print *, ceiling(x) ! returns 64     print *, ceiling(y) ! returns -63 end program test_ceiling ``` ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also FLOOR, NINT
